params.taskDescription: Imagine your family tree. You have two parents. Your parents have two parents: your grandparents. And so on. How many great-great-great-great-grandparents do you have? Hint: This would be six generations back.

params.taskDescription: Imagine your family tree. You have two parents. Your parents have two parents: your grandparents. And so on. How many great (20 times) grandparents do you have? Hint: This would be 22 generations back.

questionSetStimulus:
For the following questions, recall that the formula for interest compounded yearly is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mi>P</mi>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mrow>
        <mo>(</mo>
        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
          <mn>1</mn>
          <mo>+</mo>
          <mi>r</mi>
        </mrow>
        <mo>)</mo>
      </mrow>
      <mi>t</mi>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A = P{\left( {1 + r} \right)^t}</annotation></semantics></math>, where <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> is the amount in the account after <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>t</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">t</annotation></semantics></math> years, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>P</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">P</annotation></semantics></math> is the initial amount deposited, and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>r</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">r</annotation></semantics></math> is the interest rate per year. However, if the account is compounded monthly, the formula changes to <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mi>P</mi>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mrow>
        <mo>(</mo>
        <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
          <mn>1</mn>
          <mo>+</mo>
          <mfrac>
            <mi>r</mi>
            <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
              <mn>12</mn>
            </mrow>
          </mfrac>
        </mrow>
        <mo>)</mo>
      </mrow>
      <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
        <mn>12</mn>
        <mi>t</mi>
      </mrow>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A = P{\left( {1 + \frac{r}{{12}}} \right)^{12t}}</annotation></semantics></math>.
